page.title: 08Cider Farm.Kingsbury.
page.content: The Kingsbury area is famous for its fine cider apples.Today we walked up to the cider farm on the southern slope of Burrow Hill. First we were taken around some of the eight orchards.There are over thirty different kinds of trees and over 4000 trees.We saw Dabinett,Tremletts, Bulmer's Norman and Foxwhelp. Pests such as aphids are controlled by a minimum of spraying.We saw how cider apple shoots were being grafted onto the boughs of Worcester stock at about a height of two metres.A central tall shoot with foliage on had been left on the original tree as a perch for birds to try to prevent them from damaging the graftings.The apples are picked up from under the trees from October onwards.In recent years the local school children have been sponsored to do this,for school funds.
